jobDescription: Company Intro Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands - Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. Booking Holdings Financial Services-US (hereinafter “BHFS-US”) is based in New York City, New York and provides financial services in the form of payment services and prepaid access products across all the brands. BHFS-US is committed to conducting its business in compliance with applicable laws, regulations and guidelines, with integrity and to the highest ethical standards. Job Summary The Director of Risk is responsible for Operational & Financial Risk within the Booking family of businesses. Operational Risks are potential failures in the day to day business activities including the systems, equipment, people, and processes that supports and enables BHFS to execute on its vision and strategy. Financial Risk includes managing risks around payment and settlement activities, chargeback and fraud risk the company may become exposed to. The role of Director of Risk for BHFS US includes overseeing the control and management of the BHFS US Risk Universe, and reporting these risks to the Risk Committee on a periodic basis. The Director of Risk is also responsible for managing Projects within the BHFS Organizational structure that are specifically related to the growth and development of BHFS, and its regulated activities. The Director of Risk will be part of the Global Risk Team, an independent "second line of defense” function, that is charged with proactively identifying potential operational risks and ensuring adequate controls are in place to guard against operational and financial loss. The Operational Risk Management Team is also responsible for assessing the effectiveness of the control environment through ongoing independent challenges and targeted reviews as well as other Compliance, Conduct & Operational Risk framework. Ensuring there is an adequate business continuity plan in place for the business activities. Ensure that all regulated activities are in line with the required control environment, as stipulated in the risk control framework. Responsible for supporting the US Managing Director in the growth and development of payment activities in BHFS US. Also responsible for applying a Risk and Control framework to various special projects associated with the growth and development of BHFS US, such as system integrations, process flow design and efficiencies, etc.. Organizing the Risk Control map for BHFS US in line with the Risk Appetite of the organization. The role includes protecting the company’s assets from risk of loss due to credit risk, chargeback exposure, and fraud risk, and assessing the need for collateral. This role will be remote until the New York City location is open. Key Responsibilities Ownership of the Risk Control Framework. Engage as a key Liaison between the business units and the BHFS regulated entity regarding key risks. Assessment of business models in the context of due diligence and compliance with the guidelines of the NCA and payment institutions. Monitor policy implementation and validate adherence Manage the Risk and Control of Special projects. Drive efforts to ensure timely remediation of issues relating to policy non-compliance and emerging risk Work closely with Internal Audit to ensure all audits are scheduled with full cooperation from the functional units Facilitate internal audits in cooperation with Internal Audit team and the required functional units Ensure Remediation Plans are managed and resolved with the respective functional units in a timely fashion Ensure the Business Continuity Plan and the Disaster Recovery Plans are updated and managed. You will identify potential threats and create plans to prevent and mitigate problems. Monthly reporting. Internal contact for risk management and compliance inquiries. Training of partners and customers on risk management processes. Assist with communications with CBOI and card Associations as required Manage analyst staff Manage Risk Committee reporting for all BHFS US Risks Knowledge and Skills Third level degree qualification preferable at certificate, diploma or degree level or equivalent. 3-5 year's experience in the payments or online travel industry or in the risk management of online ecommerce business in the European market Performance of managing BCP and DR plans for regulated entities. Assessment of business models in the context of due diligence and compliance with the guidelines of the NCA and payment institutions. Managing a team of risk analysts and overseeing the key risk management functions of the team including key operational risks. Conducting assessments to define and analyze possible risks Evaluated the gravity of each risk by considering its consequences Audited processes and procedures Developed risk management controls and systems Designed processes to eliminate or mitigate potential risks Created contingency plans to manage crises Evaluated existing policies and procedures to find weaknesses Prepared reports and present recommendations Helped implement solutions and plans Evaluated employees’ risk awareness and trained them when necessary Excellent interpersonal skills and ability to influence and negotiate with senior stakeholders. Succinct Communicator - ability to break down complex issues and communicate at all levels in the organization. Ability to work in a cross-functional matrix environment Excellent understanding of vulnerability management and associated tools and solutions.. Highly motivated. Ability to work under pressure and under your own initiative. Solution driven with demonstrated ability to meet deadlines and deliver results. Excellent analytical skills. Some limited travel may be required

Company Intro Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands – Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. Job Overview The Enterprise Security Architect role at Booking Holdings is responsible for designing and supporting the implementation of a common security architecture across the Booking Holdings brands. In this role, you will have a thorough understanding of complex technology systems and stay up to date with the latest security standards, systems and security products. This role is accountable for the architectural design and ongoing lifecycle management of the security solutions that keep Booking Holdings and its brands safe. This ensures that our security investments meet our security policy and risk management objectives in an optimized and effective manner. In order to fulfil this role, the Enterprise Security Architect will need to stay abreast of not only the latest technology offering but also the threat landscape to ensure our investments are delivering on quality outcomes and meet a set criteria for the return-on-investment. A deep understanding of the broader business is a prerequisite as our security investments should map to a business outcome in that they enable and/or otherwise protect revenue generating activities from harm or impediment. The Enterprise Security Architect works across domains and Booking Holdings brands, so it includes the ability to design, collaborate, and motivate senior leaders and technical teams to follow architectural principles. A security architect’s role is to own the architectural roadmap, to define the architectural vision, and to facilitate its realization by security teams across the Booking Holdings brands. To achieve this, a security architect needs to balance long term thinking and pragmatism, and apply an agile approach to achieve the architectural vision through iterative changes. Responsibilities and Duties The key responsibility of the Security Solution Architect is to design a Security Architecture blueprint, used to drive the implementation of security safeguards across Booking Holdings brands. In more detail, core responsibilities include: Gain an understanding of the current security architecture at each brand and the specific business goals that drive decisions in each entity Design the Security Architecture blueprint for Booking Holdings, with input from security teams of all brands. Ensure a thorough understanding of the Security Architecture Blueprint across security teams in each brand, enabling brands to autonomously implement security controls and processes, inline with the blueprint Own the governance of the Booking Holdings Security Architecture, ensuring ongoing reviews and modifications to take into account changes in threats, business goals and security trends Drive the decision making process for Booking Holdings purchased security solutions; ensure the requirement gathering, vendor assessments and data gathering processes run with high standards, leading to data backed decisions that are widely accepted among the Booking Holdings security leaders Effectively collaborate with the security teams at each brand, to co-generate a Security Architecture that fits all brands; collaborate, guide and support security teams at the brands to implement the designed architecture Qualifications Bachelor's degree 5-8 year's of experience Architectural Vision: Ability to apply an organization's goals and objectives to develop and maintain architecture. Architectural Guidance: Ability to guide and advise security engineers across brands on the implementation of security controls. Architecture Standards: Ability to apply the methods, standards, and approaches for describing, analyzing, and documenting an organization's enterprise information technology (IT) architecture. Security Knowledge: Solid understanding of network access, identity, access management, applied cryptography, network security methodologies, secure software development methodologies Critical Thinking: Ability to find solutions to difficult or complex issues by applying different skills and techniques like analytical thinking, lateral thinking, and logical reasoning Agile mindset, Continuous Quality and Process Improvement Effective Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills as well as business acumen and a commercial outlook. Ability to ask relevant questions to properly engage with the speaker and really understand what they are saying, by applying listening and reflection techniques. Ability to coach, guide and improve the overall performance of stakeholders and colleagues at all levels, when appropriate, by sharing experience, knowledge and approaches to work About BKNG Booking Holdings is the world leader in online travel & related services. Our teams work around the clock to build and improve the technology that empowers people to more freely travel across borders, time zones, languages and cultures. At Booking Holdings, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world every day through seamless technology powered by our six major brands: Booking.com KAYAK priceline agoda Rentalcars.com OpenTable Through the Booking Holdings brands, we help our customers reach all corners of the earth. Our ability to provide great service rests on how well we understand our diverse customer base, which is why having a diverse team is so important to us. We bring together employees from all walks of life and we are proud to provide the kind of inclusive environment that stimulates innovation, creativity and collaboration. There are a variety of factors that go into determining a salary range, including but not limited to external market benchmark data, geographic location, and years of experience sought/required. In addition to a competitive base salary, roles are eligible to be considered for an annual bonus and equity grant. The base salary range for Connecticut and the NYC-metro area is $178,000 -$218,000. Company Intro Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands – Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. Job Overview Booking Holdings is currently undergoing a Finance Transformation initiative that will drive effective finance/accounting support for business management; promote strong governance and control in the organization; and have a world-class finance organization in terms of execution and efficiency. The Global Process Lead Record-to-Report, reporting to the Global Process Owner, Accounting, will be responsible for helping drive standardized global processes, leveraging best in class technology being implemented globally, and ensuring compliance with Company policies and procedures. This role will interface heavily with our global entities and corporate personnel at various levels across the organization, as well as the internal and external auditors. Responsibilities and Duties Partnering with GPOs to perform business process re-engineering, requirements definition gathering, process analysis and design, workflow analysis, and developing as-is and to-be business processes. Collaborate within and across the organization on key company-wide initiatives and to support the Finance transformation roadmap (people, process, technology) through establishing strong relationships with all levels of the business / cross-functional stakeholders, managing stakeholder expectations and facilitating discussions to ensure information flow, transparency, collaboration and effective execution of solutions aligned to business needs. Developing and/or influencing new ideas/approaches. Establish procedures and practices which promote the adoption of appropriate solutions and sustainability of desired results. Assisting in the identification and development of Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to objectively and continually assess process performance and determine process health. Staying up to date on industry trends and innovations, changes in accounting rules, and future finance system developments to be able to provide value-added input to the business Assisting on special projects and work streams requiring analytical skills and knowledge of systems/processes related to business acquisitions, financial systems implementations, upgrades, or changes in accounting policy. Qualifications CPA Required. Bachelor's degree. Eight or more years of experience. Ability to work across multiple functions and entities to drive governance and process enhancements. Project management and/or transformation experience, a plus. Ability to manage multiple priorities in a dynamic, rapidly growing and fluid organization. Ability to effectively communicate at various levels of the organization tailored appropriately to the audience. Candidate should demonstrate effective collaboration skills up, down and across the organization. Maintain effectiveness in continually evolving environment. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience with SAP is preferred. Experience with OneStream is a plus. Strong Microsoft Excel and Google sheets skills. jobTitle: Manager, External Reporting and Accounting Policy
jobDescription: Company Intro Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands - Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. Job Overview This position is part of the External Reporting team in Booking Holdings’ corporate finance organization. The Manager will interface with corporate office and brand (business unit) personnel at various levels of the Company, as well as with internal and external auditors. Primary responsibilities include accounting research, drafting accounting policies and memos, providing technical support and assisting in the preparation of filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (“SEC”). Responsibilities And Duties Provide technical accounting and implementation support and training to members of the worldwide finance and accounting team on the treatment of accounting issues in compliance with U.S. GAAP and SEC requirements and keep current on proposed accounting and SEC reporting matters to proactively update management and finance teams. Research, evaluate and document technical accounting implications of complex or non-standard transactions and manage interactions with and develop Company’s memos and other analysis for internal and external auditors for their audit/review of quarterly and annual financial statements and specific accounting matters, as they arise. Participate in the preparation of quarterly and annual filings with the SEC, including XBRL information, review of financial statements/ disclosures and maintain effective and efficient internal controls and participate in all required SOX compliance efforts in relation to internal controls over financial reporting. Identify and implement continuous improvements to process, controls and systems used by the External Reporting team and the broader finance organization. Collaborate with other stakeholders in the Company, especially the finance organization and partner and execute on other finance related projects and initiatives, as assigned from time to time. Qualifications 4-year college degree. U.S. CPA license required. Minimum of 7+ years of relevant experience, with a combination of Big 4 public accounting and public company industry experience. Proficient in Microsoft Office suite; Experience with Hyperion HFM a plus. Strong U.S. GAAP technical accounting and SEC reporting foundation with strong knowledge and practical experience in topics such as revenue recognition, leases, derivatives and hedging, stock-based compensation, business combination and financial statement presentation and disclosure. Strong advisory/consultative skills with a service mindset and the ability to build key working relationships with finance and accounting teams at the brands around the world. Experience implementing accounting standards and special projects. Experience in a fast moving, high growth environment providing strategic support from a financial reporting and operational standpoint. Ability to identify, escalate and respond quickly to unexpected challenges and opportunities. Strong writing, presentation and communication skills and ability to easily explain complex accounting issues and conclusions to a variety of audiences. The successful candidate will take a driving role in the team for co-developing and executing internal communications strategy, initiatives and events, while collaborating across the wider communications function to contribute to earned media strategy, social media and thought leadership. The successful candidate should have extensive experience in boosting alignment, engagement, collaboration, and creativity for employees worldwide at leading multinational corporate organizations, developing engaging strategic narratives, campaigns and content for a diverse employee base, and leveraging a range of channels and formats. Strong technology skills are required. Experience in Microsoft Suite, Gmail, and Google Docs platform; familiarity with communication tools like Slack, Zoom and Workplace. Company Intro Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands – Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. Job Overview Booking Holdings, Inc. is seeking a Communications Manager to join the Global Communications team. The successful candidate will take a driving role in the team for co-developing and executing internal communications strategy, initiatives and events, while collaborating across the wider communications function to contribute to earned media strategy, social media and thought leadership. The successful candidate should have extensive experience in boosting alignment, engagement, collaboration, and creativity for employees worldwide at leading multinational corporate organizations, developing engaging strategic narratives, campaigns and content for a diverse employee base, and leveraging a range of channels and formats. Highly organized and results-driven, this person should also have experience working with senior business leaders, be comfortable working in a fast-paced high-tech organization, and have co-managed crises and issues communications responses across a complex organization. This person has the opportunity to have an impact in devising and driving critical initiatives within the Communications organization and will be a contributor to the success of the Communications function. The Manager will report to the Director Global Communications and support key members of the Communications teams at Booking Holdings and its brands. Responsibilities and Duties Taking a leading role in executing the global Communications strategy for Booking Holdings among employees, as well as collaborating with the team on wider media, social media, reputation, crisis and issues management. Evolving internal communication formats, channel strategy and cadence in line with distributed workforce and changing business realities. Developing an approach to provide regular cross-company, cross-brand visibility on relevant projects, milestones, wins, developments and best practices, taking ownership for internal editorial calendars, and syncing closely with other communication teams across the company’s brands. Planning and executing the marking of major company moments through live, hybrid and virtual events and content, scaling quality and impact. Growing visibility of cross-company leadership teams, business units and initiatives to enhance breadth of employee knowledge and engagement Exploring and implementing enhanced measurement methodologies and best practices for different channels and content formats to track and optimize internal communication company-wide and to different audiences. Partner cross-functionally with HR, Compliance & Ethics, Sustainability, D&I Recruitment Marketing, and other departments to support in planning and execution of communication needs and create a consistent, coherent cadence of events and content for all internal stakeholders. Qualifications 8 years of progressive communications experience e.g. internal communications strategy and programs, media and social media management, crisis and issues communications etc. Knowledge and experience of operating within a Holding Company structure. Ability to influence and build effective relationships with key stakeholders, and use those relationships to enable the best possible outcome for Booking Holdings and employees. People oriented; strong relationship and stakeholder management skills, able to engage with people across all levels, and from diverse backgrounds, and navigate large global organizations. Strong project management skills, ability to run multiple projects concurrently and prioritize effectively. Understanding of business operations and organizational culture: which channels will work most effectively in different environments and why. Ability to distill complex issues or ideas into simple, honest and compelling communication; avoiding jargon and matching language to the needs of colleagues. Talent for speechwriting, developing presentations and content for senior executives. Available to offer support outside of normal business hours, or travel, as required. Strong technology skills are required. Experience in Microsoft Suite, Gmail, and Google Docs platform; familiarity with communication tools like Slack, Zoom and Workplace. Ability to responsibly manage highly confidential and time sensitive information. Knowledge of the e-commerce and travel industries. Company Intro Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands - Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. Job Overview Booking Holdings is currently undergoing a Finance Transformation initiative that will drive effective finance/accounting support for business management; promote strong governance and control in the organization; and have a world-class finance organization in terms of execution and efficiency. To support this transformation, we are hiring for a Manager, Intercompany within the Global Accounting Organization. This role, reporting to the Accounting Process Owner, will be responsible for helping drive standardized global processes, leveraging best in class technology being implemented globally, ensuring compliance with Company policies and procedures, and owning all things intercompany. Responsibilities and Duties The Manager, Intercompany is responsible for global oversight and management of intercompany and the associated end-to-end business processes, including oversight over the monthly intercompany close process and driving the evolution of the end-to-end process for capturing and reporting intercompany transactions. The Manager, Intercompany will be responsible for: Proper review of global intercompany transaction and account activity to ensure proper elimination and presentation in consolidated and standalone financial statements. Ensuring that intercompany transactions have been appropriately implemented and executed per the intercompany agreements. Oversight of all global intercompany transactions and processes, including compliance with intercompany transfer pricing agreements, as well as completeness and accuracy of intercompany accounts. Partnering with Product, Legal, FP&A and Tax teams in the development of legal entity accounting policies arising from new intercompany arrangements. Providing leadership to drive alignment and intercompany process standardization across the Booking Holdings brands globally. Implementing a global standard process model from a people, process and technology perspective in collaboration with Product, Legal, FP&A and Tax teams. Researching and preparing intercompany accounting analyses impacted by new business initiatives create and maintain transfer pricing accounting procedural documentation. Serving as the primary liaison with the Tax team to ensure calculations are accurate and compliant with TP policies and intercompany arrangements. Overseeing monthly intercompany accounting close activities. Partnering with Finance Systems and Tax teams to assist in the design and implementation of intercompany, transfer pricing automation tooling and integration with accounting systems. Implementing and monitoring intercompany accounting policies and procedures. Designing and communicating the processes and controls needed while also promoting a culture of continuous improvement. Identifying improvement opportunities to advance and accelerate the intercompany close process. Leading other special projects. Qualifications BS degree in Accounting, Finance, or General Management (CPA, or MBA preferred). Minimum 7 years of Finance and Accounting experience in a complex multinational organization. Understanding of GAAP and IFRS. Ability to work across multiple functions and entities to drive governance and process relating to intercompany operations. Excellent communication skills (both oral and written) focused on leading and influencing the global intercompany process team; comfortable to lead a diverse set of peers and stakeholders; conveys a constructive and solution-oriented mindset. Experience working with global teams in different time zones. Extensive experience and working knowledge of intercompany best practices. Intermediate to advanced proficiency in SAP and Blackline, a plus. Experience working in a global organization where leading and driving change across multiple companies is key. Ability to influence and drive change at all levels of the organization. Strong written, verbal communication, and presentation skills. Travel - 25% average during normal circumstances. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. Job Overview Booking Holdings is currently undergoing a Finance Transformation initiative that will drive effective finance/accounting support for business management; promote strong governance and control in the organization; and have a world-class finance organization in terms of execution and efficiency. To support this transformation, we are hiring for a Manager, Intercompany within the Global Accounting Organization. This role, reporting to the Accounting Process Owner, will be responsible for helping drive standardized global processes, leveraging best in class technology being implemented globally, ensuring compliance with Company policies and procedures, and owning all things intercompany. Responsibilities and Duties The Manager, Intercompany is responsible for global oversight and management of intercompany and the associated end-to-end business processes, including oversight over the monthly intercompany close process and driving the evolution of the end-to-end process for capturing and reporting intercompany transactions. The Manager, Intercompany will be responsible for: Proper review of global intercompany transaction and account activity to ensure proper elimination and presentation in consolidated and standalone financial statements. Ensuring that intercompany transactions have been appropriately implemented and executed per the intercompany agreements. Oversight of all global intercompany transactions and processes, including compliance with intercompany transfer pricing agreements, as well as completeness and accuracy of intercompany accounts. Partnering with Product, Legal, FP&A and Tax teams in the development of legal entity accounting policies arising from new intercompany arrangements. Providing leadership to drive alignment and intercompany process standardization across the Booking Holdings brands globally. Implementing a global standard process model from a people, process and technology perspective in collaboration with Product, Legal, FP&A and Tax teams. Researching and preparing intercompany accounting analyses impacted by new business initiatives create and maintain transfer pricing accounting procedural documentation. Serving as the primary liaison with the Tax team to ensure calculations are accurate and compliant with TP policies and intercompany arrangements. Overseeing monthly intercompany accounting close activities. Partnering with Finance Systems and Tax teams to assist in the design and implementation of intercompany, transfer pricing automation tooling and integration with accounting systems. Implementing and monitoring intercompany accounting policies and procedures. Designing and communicating the processes and controls needed while also promoting a culture of continuous improvement. Identifying improvement opportunities to advance and accelerate the intercompany close process. Leading other special projects. Qualifications BS degree in Accounting, Finance, or General Management (CPA, or MBA preferred). Minimum 7 years of Finance and Accounting experience in a complex multinational organization. Understanding of GAAP and IFRS. Ability to work across multiple functions and entities to drive governance and process relating to intercompany operations. Excellent communication skills (both oral and written) focused on leading and influencing the global intercompany process team; comfortable to lead a diverse set of peers and stakeholders; conveys a constructive and solution-oriented mindset. Experience working with global teams in different time zones. Extensive experience and working knowledge of intercompany best practices. Intermediate to advanced proficiency in SAP and Blackline, a plus. Experience working in a global organization where leading and driving change across multiple companies is key. Ability to influence and drive change at all levels of the organization. Strong written, verbal communication, and presentation skills. Travel - 25% average during normal circumstances. Our teams work around the clock to build and improve the technology that empowers people to more freely travel across borders, time zones, languages and cultures. Our ability to provide great service rests on how well we understand our diverse customer base, which is why having a diverse team is so important to us. Company Intro Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands – Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. Job Overview Booking Holdings is currently undergoing a Finance Transformation initiative that will drive effective finance support for business management; promote strong governance and control in the organization; and have a world-class finance organization in terms of execution and efficiency. This program is focused on bringing standard business processes across our portfolio of brands, and will rely on our financial systems to establish and drive standards (People, Process, and Systems) To support this transformation, the organization has created a Global Business Services (GBS) Organization. This organization consists of newly established Global Process Owner Organization (Record to Report, Procure to Pay, Order to Cash, Contract Lifecycle Management, and others); and Transformation focused roles (Enterprise Program Management, Process Excellence, Communications & Change, Master Data, and Financial Analysis) As part of our procure to pay transformation, we are in the process of implementing a new set of financial systems leveraging Ivalua ; SAP Invoice Management by OpenText (VIM); Simfoni Spend Analytics; and SAP S/4 Hana. These programs are being deployed across our portfolio of brands, and led by our Global Process Owner Procure to Pay, with close partnerships from our brand leaders, and executive sponsors. To assist in driving these initiatives, Booking Holdings is looking for a Manager, Procure to Pay Global Business Services. This role will be responsible for working across a broad group of stakeholders with different interests and priorities. This role will be critical in operating within the GPO organization to assist the P2P leadership with execution of these critical initiatives. The role will have significant leadership responsibility and will be expected to drive change through influence, relationships, communications, and execution. This individual will have experience working between the business and Financial Technology/ Financial Systems to lead requirements gathering, translate changes in business process into technical requirements, and to assist in the development of process documentation. This role will also be responsible for the development of test cases, test scenarios, planning user acceptance testing, in addition to training, business adoption, and ongoing continuous improvement. This role will also be required to work effectively and to coordinate across 3rd parties and system integrators. And finally, to assist in overseeing process and strategy improvements related to Sourcing, Procurement, Supplier Management, Receiving, Invoicing, and Payments, as well as managing PTP technology developments through S/4 HANA and Ivalua SaaS solutions. Responsibilities and Duties Leverage global technical solutions and process to drive common practice across portfolio of Brands (Booking.com, Agoda, Priceline, Open Table, Kayak, and others) Provide weekly status updates to EPMO, highlighting key milestones, risks, issues, and cross-functional dependencies Collaborate with the Controls Integration team to ensure design is in compliance standard SOX policies Understands local requirements (Regional, Brand, or Business Unit Specific) to translate into a global set of requirements for our technical teams to deliver a global solution Drive complex discussions across business, technical, and 3rd parties to translate into a clear future state process, value proposition, with supporting technical requirements Can support GPO in driving ongoing leadership forums, steering committees, and roadshows to foster positive working relationships, deal with issues timely, manage risks, and build program momentum Assist GPO in bringing industry best practices to the functional teams and focus on leading practices.. Develop business process flows using Visio, Lucid, or other process mapping tools to clearly document current to future state requirements Ability to drive fit gap discussions Perform root cause analysis, structured problem solving, and value stream mapping Drive business readiness and change management within the PTP functions to support new process and or technology rollouts Build and manage business requirements, training documentation, process playbooks, SOPs and repository Drive common practices across GPO organization , working with Record to Report, Procure to Pay, and other process areas beyond P2P Qualifications Bachelors Business Administration, Computer Science, Engineering, or related discipline - MBA a plus Minimum of 5 years supporting Procure to Pay Process Experience with ERP implementations, SAP Modules, and Configuration a plus Direct experience with implementations of P2P systems ideally Ivalua, or equivalent (Ariba, Coupa,ect) Experience with Contract management systems helpful such as Icertis, or Conga Experience with workflow systems and business process automation Experience being involved in large-scale transformation programs Demonstrated knowledge of Business Process Improvement, Process excellence, and operational excellence Demonstrated use of analysis and metrics relating to adoption, progress and overall business operational performance that transferred to continuous improvement or new ways of working Ability to work in a team environment, effectively interacting with others Must be results-oriented, demonstrate adaptability, flexibility, and resourcefulness Strong project management skills for planning, resourcing, monitoring multiple projects and initiatives Strong qualitative, quantitative, analytical and critical thinking skills Collaborative team player orientation towards work relationships aligned to company values Capable of developing process where none existed, partner with business and IT to recommend and develop comprehensive plans to improve business process and performance in multiple areas High degree of creativity, vision and adaptability to changing trends and/or business demands Ability to work in a consistently growing environment and with partners in person and virtual Ability to take full ownership of things in support of GPO with minimal supervision and direction. Manage time and effectively prioritize demand Ability to understand strategic vision to develop and execute an approach to new or improved business processes aligned to supporting technical solutions. Company Intro Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands – Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. Job Overview Booking Holdings is currently undergoing a Finance Transformation initiative that will drive effective finance support for business management; promote strong governance and control in the organization; and have a world-class finance organization in terms of execution and efficiency. This program is focused on bringing standard business processes across our portfolio of brands, and will rely on our financial systems to establish and drive standards (People, Process, and Systems) To support this transformation, the organization has created a Global Business Services (GBS) Organization. This organization consists of newly established Global Process Owner Organization (Record to Report, Procure to Pay, Order to Cash, Contract Lifecycle Management, and others); and Transformation focused roles (Enterprise Program Management, Process Excellence, Communications & Change, Master Data, and Financial Analysis) As part of our procure to pay transformation, we are in the process of implementing a new set of financial systems leveraging Ivalua ; SAP Invoice Management by OpenText (VIM); Simfoni Spend Analytics; and SAP S/4 Hana. These programs are being deployed across our portfolio of brands, and led by our Global Process Owner Procure to Pay, with close partnerships from our brand leaders, and executive sponsors. To assist in driving these initiatives, Booking Holdings is looking for a Manager, Procure to Pay Global Business Services. This role will be responsible for working across a broad group of stakeholders with different interests and priorities. This role will be critical in operating within the GPO organization to assist the P2P leadership with execution of these critical initiatives. The role will have significant leadership responsibility and will be expected to drive change through influence, relationships, communications, and execution. This individual will have experience working between the business and Financial Technology/ Financial Systems to lead requirements gathering, translate changes in business process into technical requirements, and to assist in the development of process documentation. This role will also be responsible for the development of test cases, test scenarios, planning user acceptance testing, in addition to training, business adoption, and ongoing continuous improvement. This role will also be required to work effectively and to coordinate across 3rd parties and system integrators. And finally, to assist in overseeing process and strategy improvements related to Sourcing, Procurement, Supplier Management, Receiving, Invoicing, and Payments, as well as managing PTP technology developments through S/4 HANA and Ivalua SaaS solutions. Responsibilities And Duties Partner with Finance Leadership, Controllership, FP&A, IT, Risk & Controls, Global Internal Audit and Business Teams and Third-Party Vendors and System Implementers to execute against strategic initiative timelines Drives delivery and execution of a specific functional process area (i.e. RTR, Treasury, Tax, PTP, OTC) across the S/4 project implementation lifecycle (i.e. across design and build sprints, mock conversion, testing, training and cutover activities). Contributes to the Project scoping and planning by documenting project goals, requirements, KPIs, roadmap and main deliverables, tracks completion of project milestones and maintains project artifacts. Interacts with project sponsors, project stakeholders and multiple business and technical teams to define and document requirements, key design decisions and complex features. Manages project Actions, Risks, Issues and Dependencies, including appropriate escalations and anticipates bottlenecks while balancing business needs with technical constraints. Works with the Organizational Change Management team to ensure appropriate communication planning, stakeholder analysis, and change management activities. Works with the Controls Integration and Risk & Controls teams to ensure appropriate diligence is taken to identify and address any controls implications across the implementation lifecycle Creates, maintains and disseminates project information, project issues and status to stakeholders, in a concise, accurate, and professional manner. Adheres to and helps improve internal governance and program management standards across the Enterprise Program Management Office. Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree required. 5-8 years of experience leading global strategic initiatives, within a shared services environment undergoing financial transformation Experience working as a program or project manager on prior finance transformations Experience working with SAP ECC or SAP S/4 HANA either as a user or as part of an ERP implementation Experience leading global strategic initiatives, within a shared services environment undergoing a finance transformation PMP or related certifications preferred Understands and can execute initiatives using the PMBOK framework to move an initiative efficiently through the project lifecycle Experience leading technical requirements gathering using SDLC preferred Knowledge of Procure-to-Pay, Record-to-Report, Tax, Treasury or Order-to-Cash business processes Understanding of Accounting Practices and Standards such as US GAAP and IFRS Ability to apply structured problem solving methods to address issues and drive root cause identification Skilled communicator and proven relationship builder, able to operate within a multitude of formal and informal networks while managing the competing interests of varied stakeholders Ability to work successfully with consulting teams and strategic partners to maximize value and accelerate change Experience operating in, and driving alignment and consensus in a complex and matrix environment Experience working with global teams, capable of bringing together stakeholders, to align requirements and drive improvements Proven ability to interact with and influence peers and senior management in a complex, geographically dispersed organization Self-directed, dynamic and customer-centric change-agent who thrives in a challenging and changing environment 25% average travel during normal circumstances About BKNG Booking Holdings is the world leader in online travel & related services. jobTitle: Senior Accountant, External Reporting and Technical Accounting
jobDescription: Company Intro Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands - Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The Senior Accountant will interface with corporate office and brand (business unit) personnel at various levels of the Company, as well as with internal and external auditors. Primary responsibilities include accounting research, drafting accounting policies and memos, providing technical support and assisting in the preparation of filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (“SEC”). Responsibilities and Duties Provide technical accounting and implementation support to members of the worldwide finance and accounting team on the treatment of accounting issues in compliance with U.S. GAAP and SEC requirements and keep current on proposed accounting and SEC reporting matters to proactively update management and finance teams Research, evaluate and document technical accounting implications of complex or non-standard transactions and manage interactions with and develop Company’s memos and other analysis for internal and external auditors for their audit/review of quarterly and annual financial statements and specific accounting matters, as they arise. Participate in the preparation of quarterly and annual filings with the SEC, including XBRL information, financial statements/ disclosures and maintain effective and efficient internal controls and participate in all required SOX compliance efforts in relation to internal controls over financial reporting. Identify and implement continuous improvements to process, controls and systems used by the External Reporting team and the broader finance organization. Collaborate with other stakeholders in the Company, especially the finance organization and partner and execute on other finance related projects and initiatives, as assigned from time to time. Qualifications 4-year college degree. U.S. CPA license required. Minimum of 4+ years of relevant Big 4 public accounting experience Proficient in Microsoft Office suite; Experience with Hyperion HFM a plus. Strong U.S. GAAP technical accounting and SEC reporting foundation with knowledge and practical experience in topics such as revenue recognition, leases and financial statement presentation and disclosure. Strong advisory/consultative skills with a service mindset and the ability to build key working relationships with finance and accounting teams at the brands around the world. Ability to identify, escalate and respond quickly to unexpected challenges and opportunities. Strong writing, presentation and communication skills and ability to easily explain complex accounting issues and conclusions to a variety of audiences. Job Overview This position is part of the External Reporting team in Booking Holdings’ corporate finance organization. The Senior Accountant will interface with corporate office and brand (business unit) personnel at various levels of the Company, as well as with internal and external auditors. Primary responsibilities include accounting research, drafting accounting policies and memos, providing technical support and assisting in the preparation of filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (“SEC”). Minimum of 4+ years of relevant Big 4 public accounting experience Proficient in Microsoft Office suite; Experience with Hyperion HFM a plus. Strong U.S. GAAP technical accounting and SEC reporting foundation with knowledge and practical experience in topics such as revenue recognition, leases and financial statement presentation and disclosure. Strong advisory/consultative skills with a service mindset and the ability to build key working relationships with finance and accounting teams at the brands around the world. jobTitle: Senior Manager, External Reporting and Technical Accounting
jobDescription: Company Intro Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands - Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. Job Overview This position is part of the External Reporting team in Booking Holdings’ corporate finance organization. The Senior Manager will interface with corporate office and brand (business unit) personnel at various levels of the Company, as well as with internal and external auditors. Primary responsibilities include accounting research, drafting accounting policies and memos, providing technical support and assisting in the preparation of filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (“SEC”). Responsibilities and Duties Provide technical accounting and implementation support and training to members of the worldwide finance and accounting team on the treatment of accounting issues in compliance with U.S. GAAP and SEC requirements and keep current on proposed accounting and SEC reporting matters to proactively update management and finance teams. Research, evaluate and document technical accounting implications of complex or non-standard transactions and manage interactions with and develop Company’s memos and other analysis for internal and external auditors for their audit/review of quarterly and annual financial statements and specific accounting matters, as they arise. Participate in the preparation of quarterly and annual filings with the SEC, including XBRL information, review of financial statements/ disclosures and maintain effective and efficient internal controls and participate in all required SOX compliance efforts in relation to internal controls over financial reporting. Identify and implement continuous improvements to process, controls and systems used by the External Reporting team and the broader finance organization. Collaborate with other stakeholders in the Company, especially the finance organization and partner and execute on other finance related projects and initiatives, as assigned from time to time. Qualifications 4-year college degree. U.S. CPA license required. Minimum of 10+ years of relevant experience, with a combination of Big 4 public accounting and public company industry experience. jobDescription: Company Intro Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands - Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. Job Overview This position is part of the External Reporting team in Booking Holdings’ corporate finance organization. The Senior Manager will interface with corporate office and brand (business unit) personnel at various levels of the Company, as well as with internal and external auditors. Primary responsibilities include accounting research, drafting accounting policies and memos, providing technical support and assisting in the preparation of filings with the Securities and Exchange Commission (“SEC”). Responsibilities and Duties Provide technical accounting and implementation support and training to members of the worldwide finance and accounting team on the treatment of accounting issues in compliance with U.S. GAAP and SEC requirements and keep current on proposed accounting and SEC reporting matters to proactively update management and finance teams. Research, evaluate and document technical accounting implications of complex or non-standard transactions and manage interactions with and develop Company’s memos and other analysis for internal and external auditors for their audit/review of quarterly and annual financial statements and specific accounting matters, as they arise. Participate in the preparation of quarterly and annual filings with the SEC, including XBRL information, review of financial statements/ disclosures and maintain effective and efficient internal controls and participate in all required SOX compliance efforts in relation to internal controls over financial reporting. Identify and implement continuous improvements to process, controls and systems used by the External Reporting team and the broader finance organization. Collaborate with other stakeholders in the Company, especially the finance organization and partner and execute on other finance related projects and initiatives, as assigned from time to time. Qualifications 4-year college degree. U.S. CPA license required. Minimum of 10+ years of relevant experience, with a combination of Big 4 public accounting and public company industry experience. Proficient in Microsoft Office suite; Experience with Hyperion HFM a plus. Strong U.S. GAAP technical accounting and SEC reporting foundation with expert knowledge and practical experience in topics such as revenue recognition, leases, derivatives and hedging, stock-based compensation, business combination and financial statement presentation and disclosure. Strong advisory/consultative skills with a service mindset and the ability to build key working relationships with finance and accounting teams at the brands around the world. Experience implementing accounting standards and special projects. Experience in a fast moving, high growth environment providing strategic direction from a financial reporting and operational standpoint. Ability to identify, escalate and respond quickly to unexpected challenges and opportunities. Strong writing, presentation and communication skills and ability to easily explain complex accounting issues and conclusions to a variety of audiences. Ability to effectively lead, inspire and develop potential team members. About BKNG Booking Holdings is the world leader in online travel & related services. Our teams work around the clock to build and improve the technology that empowers people to more freely travel across borders, time zones, languages and cultures. At Booking Holdings, we make it easier for everyone to experience the world every day through seamless technology powered by our six major brands: Booking.com KAYAK priceline agoda Rentalcars.com OpenTable Through the Booking Holdings brands, we help our customers reach all corners of the earth. Our ability to provide great service rests on how well we understand our diverse customer base, which is why having a diverse team is so important to us. We bring together employees from all walks of life and we are proud to provide the kind of inclusive environment that stimulates innovation, creativity and collaboration. There are a variety of factors that go into determining a salary range, including but not limited to external market benchmark data, geographic location, and years of experience sought/required. In addition to a competitive base salary, roles are eligible to be considered for an annual bonus and equity grant. The base salary range for Connecticut and the NYC-metro area is $156,000 - $190,000. Company Intro Booking Holdings (NASDAQ: BKNG) is the world leader in online travel and related services, provided to customers and partners in over 220 countries and territories through six primary consumer-facing brands - Booking.com, KAYAK, priceline, agoda.com, Rentalcars.com, and OpenTable. The mission of Booking Holdings is to make it easier for everyone to experience the world. During 2019, the Company had consolidated revenues and net income of $15.1 billion and $4.9 billion, respectively, and a current market value of approximately $60 billion. Booking Holdings Financial Services-US (hereinafter “BHFS-US”) is based in New York City, New York and provides financial services in the form of payment services and prepaid access products across all the brands. BHFS-US is committed to conducting its business in compliance with applicable laws, regulations and guidelines, with integrity and to the highest ethical standards. Job Summary Booking Holdings Financial Services-US, is looking for a Head of State Regulatory & Exam Management with strong experience in Financial Services, specifically Money Transmission, to act as a critical partner to our business, helping develop, launch, and enable our mission to deliver a world-class payments operation to support Booking Holdings Inc’s brands. The selected candidate will have the chance to witness firsthand the investment in digital technology that helps take the friction out of travel. The Head of State Regulatory & Exam Management will ensure compliance with all US license requirements, including but not limited to annual reporting, renewals and applications. This position will also assist the Chief Compliance Officer with all regulatory communications, interactions, exams, regulatory inquiries, etc. You’ll report directly to the Chief Compliance Officer. Harnessing the strategic vision of the company this role will be responsible for managing the BHFS-US relationships with US State and Territory regulators. Given the collaborative nature of the business you will be consistently partnering with the brands product, operations, engineering and marketing teams to ensure you understand the intricacies of operations, in addition to the international/global compliance teams. This opportunity represents an exceptional chance to embed yourself with one of the world’s most exciting organizations and help define the future for accessing travel experiences across the world.
